item.title: NW6 6BB, on Donaldson Road alongside 79 Brondesbury Road, 7th August
item.description:
There is a large council-owned tree in this location. The tree is very large (and beautiful) but is causing significant damage to the pavement. More importantly to us as residents of 79 Brondesbury Road, as it has grown it appears that the roots are causing damage to the brick wall on the perimeter of our property, making it bow quite noticeably with risk of the wall falling into our garden or onto the pavement. Additionally this tree has not been pollarded in recent memory and the branches also overhang our property significantly and the water runoff is also having effect on the brick garden wall and the wooden fencing on top of it. Could we please request a tree officer come and inspect this tree and also the damage it is causing to our property?
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Donaldson Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 06/08/25 there was a black male Jamaican smoking marijuana in the public park with two white eastern European females. Someone could please address this anti-social behavior seen as families are using the park on school holidays. This is a public park for families and children to use and this anti-social behavior should not be going on in a public space., 7th August
item.description:
A legal marijuana being smoked in public park. Antisocial behaviour.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Footpaths Across Mabley Green, Hackney, London

item.title: Hackney Council can you please address this issue in local public park. The issue is some genius or clever person has put a public rubbish pin right next to a bench where public people can come and sit and enjoy the park for the day but the bin is so close to the bench you get a horrid stench all the time of dog s***, can, bottles of beer that has been thrown inside bin on a hot day. The bins need to be relocated at least ten meters away from the park bench so members are public can sit down and enjoy the park especially on school summer holidays why children play. When you smell this horrible stench and you're sitting right next to a public bin you do not want to spend any time in this crap park because of this., 7th August
item.description:
Hackney Council can you please address this issue in local public park. The issue is some genius or clever person has put a public rubbish pin right next to a bench where public people can come and sit and enjoy the park for the day but the bin is so close
